contentrichtext.text: {{For|the 1990 comedy film|Club Fed (film)}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {{No footnotes|date=December 2009}} In [[North American English]], '''Club Fed''' is a term that describes a [[prison]] whose accommodations are less severe than many other prisons. The term is a [[pun]] on the "[[Club Med]]" chain of [[all-inclusive resort]]s. The 1999 movie ''[[Office Space]]'' made a reference to this style of prison by referring to it as a, "white-collar, minimum-security resort." They also referred to the opposite of this as, "Federal Pound Me In The Ass Prison". ==Differential treatment for white-collar offenders== Because white-collar crimes are committed without violence, they are most likely to garner less severe criminal penalties.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} {{Main|White-collar_crime#Definitional_issues}} ==Club Fed in Canada== In [[Canada]], "Club Fed" was used derisively to describe the [[Joliette Institution For Women]], the [[Joliette]] [[prison]] where [[serial killer]] [[Karla Homolka]] was held, because of the prison's supposedly luxurious conditions and lax restrictions, claims the prison has denied.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} ==See also== *[[List of U.S. federal prisons]] *[[Alderson Federal Prison Camp]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.fact.on.ca/newpaper/ts99110c.htm Prison in Joliette is known as 'Club Fed'- Toronto Star] [[Category:Prisons in the United States]]
